text: Inform consumers at or before the point of collection about the categories of personal information to be collected.
Do not collect additional categories of PI or use PI for incompatible purposes without providing notice.
Inform consumers of the length of time the business intends to retain each category of personal information.
Collection, use, retention, and sharing of PI shall be reasonably necessary and proportionate.
Implement reasonable security procedures and practices.
Ensure contracts with Service Providers, Contractors, and Third Parties are in place to protect PI.
Delete a consumer's personal information upon receipt of a verifiable consumer request.
Correct inaccurate personal information upon receipt of a verifiable consumer request.
Provide a clear and conspicuous link on the business’s Internet homepage(s), titled ’Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information’.
Provide a clear and conspicuous link on the business’s Internet homepage(s), titled ’Limit the Use of My Sensitive Personal Information’.
Stop using and disclosing sensitive personal information for purposes other than those specified in the regulations upon request.
Do not discriminate against a consumer because the consumer exercised any of their rights.
Disclose information about consumer rights and how to exercise them in a privacy policy.
Ensure that the business’s privacy policy is updated at least once every 12 months.
Maintain reasonable security procedures to protect personal information from unauthorized access, theft, or disclosure.
